list_definition.definition: a small, printed sheet containing information etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They were handing out leaflets in the street.

list_ex_of_english: There is continuity of the leaflets of the aortic and pulmonary valves because of absence of the outlet septum.
The rule ofclosure may be broken when there is no preoperative regurgitation and the edges of the adjacent leaflets are very thin.
The valve guarding the left atrioventricular junction has three leaflets.
The tricuspid valve had thickening and tethering of its leaflets without downward displacement.
Small area jet seen close to the point of coaptation of the valvar leaflets and directed towards the posterior wall of the left atrium.
The classification is based on the severity of the displacement of the septal and posteroinferior leaflets, with four grades of increasing severity.
Many spoke about distributing posters and leaflets to places where people in the community would pick them up, such as libraries, supermarkets and pharmacies.
Thickened, dysplastic pulmonary valvar leaflets and a bicuspid aortic valve were also noted.
